channel.title: Announcment every 5 mins
channel.description: How do i make a announcement sayying something every 5 minutes on project insanity. and how do i put writing ontop of the npc like when someone new joins and the npc is saying welcome.. etc

item.title: Announcment every 5 mins
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

You’re not executing it.

Read full topic

item.title: Announcment every 5 mins
item.dc:creator: @Joseph69 Joseph69
item.description:
@Joseph69 wrote:

[quote=“AtomicInt_, post:19, topic:428641”][code=java]
private final int TIME = 1;

private void timedMessage() {
EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
    @Override
    public void execute(EventContainer e) {
	for (final Player player : PlayerHandler.players) {
	    final Client o = (Client) player;
	    o.sendMessage("Message");
	}
    }
}, TIME);
}

[/code]

Change the integer “TIME” to the desired time in milliseconds, then where the player is connected to the server add [tt]this.timedMessage();[/tt]

I’d use a switch instead of huge if else blocks.

No, you should learn to program and use ONE message String to print multiple messages when needed.[/quote]STILL now working can someone like fix it for me on teamviewer or if i done something wrong ? please i need it working.

Read full topic

item.title: Announcment every 5 mins
item.dc:creator: @ExtremeX-Scape Ryley
item.description:
@ExtremeX-Scape wrote:

    private final int TIME = 1;

    private void timedMessage() {
	EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() {
	    @Override
	    public void execute(EventContainer e) {
		for (final Player player : PlayerHandler.players) {
		    final Client o = (Client) player;
		    o.sendMessage("Message");
		}
	    }
	}, TIME);
    }

Change the integer “TIME” to the desired time in milliseconds, then where the player is connected to the server add [tt]this.timedMessage();[/tt]

Repu:

I’d use a switch instead of huge if else blocks.

No, you should learn to program and use ONE message String to print multiple messages when needed.

Read full topic

item.title: Announcment every 5 mins
item.dc:creator: @Joseph69 Joseph69
item.description:
@Joseph69 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:13, topic:428641”][quote author=Joseph69 link=topic=531332.msg3882046#msg3882046 date=1326110295]

Here’s the exact copy out of my server with no edits.

public void mymessage() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { int r3 = 0; r3 = Misc.random(6); /* if (r3 == 0) { sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[AbstractPK</col>]: Please vote everyday, to keep the server going!"); } else */ if (r3 == 1) { sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[AbstractPK</col>]: Donations are appreciated, thanks =)"); } else if (r3 == 2) { sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[Update</col>]: Forums is currently being revamped."); } else if (r3 == 3) { sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[Update</col>]: Server is currently under going a make-over."); } else if (r3 == 4) { sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[Important</col>]: Please report all bugs to a staff."); } else if (r3 == 5) { sendMessage("<shad=15695415>[AbstractPK</col>]: Dont forget to click save in your quest tab!"); } } }, 230000); //milisecondsservermessage };

Go into server sided client.java and search for public void sendMessage
Post right above that.
[/quote]ty no more errors but , how come its not sending it ? do i need to put shorter timing ?

You need to execute it.[/quote]Can you please tell me how? i really need it working please mate , thanks.

Read full topic

item.title: Announcment every 5 mins
item.dc:creator: @Joseph69 Joseph69
item.description:
@Joseph69 wrote:

[quote=“Team_Rocket, post:9, topic:428641”][quote author=sk8rdude461 link=topic=531332.msg3882026#msg3882026 date=1326108332]
Put this where ever in your client.java:

public void mymessage() { EventManager.getSingleton().addEvent(new Event() { public void execute(EventContainer c) { int r3 = 0; r3 = Misc.random(6); /* if (r3 == 0) { sendMessage(""); } else if (r3 == 1) { sendMessage(""); } } }, 230000); //milisecondsservermessage };
Add what you want in the quotes. I’m sure you can figure the rest out.
[/quote]

I doubt he’ll know anything about an event if he’s having trouble with this.[/quote]I get 100 errors , aswell… can someone just help me…
